page.title: 04Coombe Farm, Plymstock
page.content: {Coombe Farm has been owned by Mr {MacBean since 1940. The whole of the {farmland and buildings adds up to 69.5 {acres which includes a tythe barn and {a farmhouse. The farmhouse and the {tythe barn are both listed buildings. {Mr MacBean owns a herd of 50 Friesian {cows. He has one Charolais calf, a {Friesian bull and a calf bull. A calf {costs Â£600, a top pedigree calf or {cow costs Â£1000 and an old cow costs {Â£400_Â£500. Part of his farmhouse is {made of limestone which was quarried {from the quarry in the woods at the {back of his house. The land is used {for livestock. He does organic and {chemical farming. The names of some of {the fields are High Bottom Park, Lower {Bottom Park,Little Square Meadow,Lower {Orchard,Coombe Break and Great East {Down. { }
